intro: Trigonotis formosana var. formosana, commonly known as the Taiwan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like butterflies and bees. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
